Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that WHO DG Tedros Ghebreyesus has tested positive for Covid-19, when there is no evidence or confirmation of this.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that Tedros only mentioned being a contact of someone who tested positive for Covid-19 and did not confirm his own positive test.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or confirmation provided to support the assertion that Tedros tested positive for Covid-19.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Tedros' self-quarantine is due to his own positive test, when he explicitly stated that it was in line with WHO protocols for being a contact of a positive case.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that Tedros may have tested negative for Covid-19 or may not have been tested at all.
